comments:
I was playing with my project and I switched from Debug to Release config and started getting these exceptions. Project attached.

Created an attachment (id=66016)
Problem project

Here's the project.
*** Bug 185670 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
It's because I have a .cpp and a .s file with the same basename (I was peeking at the generated assembly for my latest blog entry :). We should probably generate a better error message in this case.

I made the better message to be displayed in case of a failure like this.
Here is the current build output for the case the project contains the a.c and a.cpp files located in the project root

**** Rebuild of configuration Debug for project mgw6 ****

**** Internal Builder is used for build               ****
Build error
Generated resource conflict: 
two resources of the same name: /mgw6/Debug/a.o 
generated by different tools 
tool1: GCC C++ Compiler 
tool2: GCC C Compiler

I'll keep the bug openned and will update the bug summary to more reflect the issue.

Note: the error occurs both with Internal Builder and GnuMakefileGenerator.
The Internal Builder behaves more correctly in this case: it fails, while the GnuMakefileGenerator does not treat the error anyhow. Thus the build might suceed while one of the object files would be overwritten by another with the same name and thus would not be included in the resulting binary.
